result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan C Whiteside

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan C Whiteside not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Juan C Whiteside.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.  
Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter (22CF2881) in Branch 45 and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 45 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Case adjourned to Branch 15. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Juan C Whiteside not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Juan C Whiteside.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with Amazon; J I
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  24/7 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment, medical and legal appointments. If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Juan C Whiteside appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maryann Corea appeared by video for Juan C Whiteside.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference. This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Juan C Whiteside not in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/04/2022@01:30pm
